text: Oreta bilineata is a moth in the family Drepanidae. It was described by Hong- Fu Chu and Lin-Yao Wang in 1987. It is found in Sichuan, China. The length of the forewings is 18–20 mm. Adults can be distinguished from related species by the dark forewings with two oblique lines., 1987: Studies on the taxonomy and zoogeography of the Chinese Oretinae (Lepidoptera: Drepanidae). Acta Entomologica Sinica 30 (3): 291–303. ==References== Category:Moths described in 1987 Category:Drepaninae Category:Moths of China
title: Oreta bilineata
